Posts.Content: May 12, 2013 04:10PM Tracyinva wrote: Can someone please help me with a question. I am scheduled to have a lumpectomy and also with a plastic surgeon that is going to fill in the gap with some extra fatty tissue from my breast. Then he is going to do a breast uplift at the same time. Then I go through radiation and then some months later I get another breast off left on the breast that does not have cancer. Has anyone else had this procedure?. I am really confused. He called it something like osctomy or something like that can someone help explain this?.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy: Your tips for preparation & recovery? CassDugan carol57

Posts.Content: Tracyinva wrote: Very nervous. They are supposed to be the best the country so I gave u my old doc which I did not was working well for me personally or professional try try one of the best cancer centers around. Everything is faxed. They have all my reports. They are doing their own pathology tomomorow. I think I even get to met the rest of the staff involved in the process. Has anyone else to be JH and has any stories to share? Tracy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 2nd opinion with a consult at john hopkins on Monday Tracyinva PeggySull

Posts.Content: May 6, 2013 11:10PM Tracyinva wrote: Welll I was scheduled to have my age 40 mammo but in interm I found a lump on my right breast. I just had a regular gyn appt back in Feb and had a breast exam and nothing was felt and that is when I got my referral for my baseline mammo but I felt a lump before that so I went in. The dr referred me to the radiologist and they did the mammo and saw the lump. They then recommeded a biopsy for the lump which came back cancerrous along with another small node which I could not feel yet.  They have me schedule for  breast doctor on wed to acesss the options on what I should do next. I hope that makes sense. I really do not know what they are going to do at the appt. I would assume tell me the extent of the mass and the treatment options?

I honestly dont know anything at this point because I am still in shoick.

Posts.Content: Tracyinva wrote: I had annual gyn exam in april...the midwife did a look for signs of breast cancer..felt nothing. I had referral due to my age to get a mammo since I am 40..got it last week after I felt a lump..they did a sono said it was cancer and the one small node. I have no idea how far advance it is. I go Wed for testing and full evaluation. I am so worried. I feel like my life has just stopped in time. All I do is cry all day and night Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 6, 2013 11:20PM Tracyinva wrote: From what I was told I had 2 options I could have my right breast removed and recoctruct it or have a lumpectomy.  They did not realy discuss radtion or chemo with me. So I have no idea how far along. I have asked them numerous quetions but they are always so vague until they understand how problematic the cancer is..My armpit lymph nodes aren't swollen either are my neck lymph nodes.  I am just so scared for Wed I can't take chemo from all the horror stories I have heard.
